Adiabatic warming: The temperature increase produced in a descending.air mass as pressure .. increases ,with decreasing altitude.
Ambient air quality standards:
sequence.container-title: ·Criteria Pollutants and National Ambient Air Quality Standards.) .

sequence.title: ATPS condition (ATPS): Ambient temperature and pressure, saturated with water vapor. These are the conditions existing in a water spirometer.
Carbon dioxide (COi): A colorless, odorless, nonpoisonous gas, which results from fossil fuel combustion and is normally a part of the ambient air.
Central nervous system (CNS): The portion of the nervous system that includes••the brain ancl spinal cord, and their connecting nerves.
Combustion: Burning, or rapid oxidation, accompanied by release of energy in the form of heat and light. A basic cause of air pollution.

sequence.author: EPA: The U.S.
sequence.title: Environmental Protection Agency; established in 1970 by Presidential Executive Order, bringing together parts of various government agencies involved with the control of pollution.

sequence.author: Minute ventilation (VE):
sequence.title: Volume of air breathed in one minut.e. It is a product,
sequence.note: of tidal • • volume (VT) and breathing frequency (fB). (See ventilation.)

sequence.title: National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS): Air quality standards established by EPA that_apply to outside air throughout the country ..
Photochemical smog: Air pollution caused by sunlight-activated chemical reac1ions among various pollutants emitted from different sources.
Respiratory frequency (f0: The number of breathing cycles per unit of time.

sequence.note: VE = Expired volume per minute (BTPS), and V1 - Inspired volume per minute (BTPS).
